author: mratsim
content:
I see EVM384 similar to Intel software development emulator https://software.intel.com/content/www/us/en/develop/articles/intel-software-development-emulator.html.
it allows testing the latest Intel extensions (say AVX512 or SHA256 instructions) on CPU that doesn't support it.
This allows developing libraries that use those extensions before the hardware is available and without buying the hardware.

So EVM384 would allow testing BLS12-381 based protocol on Eth1 without waiting for the hard fork.

author: mratsim
content: No, BLS12-381 is the smallest and most efficient curve that meet the 128-bit (127.5 actually) security requirement.

author: mratsim
content: BLST is undergoing security audit and formal verification.
